Package fi.sdeska.messenger.client

Class MessengerClient

java.lang.Object
fi.sdeska.messenger.client.MessengerClient
public class MessengerClient extends Object
Handles the backend of the clientside application. This includes the connections to the server and possible other clients.

  • Method Details

    • connectToServer

      public boolean connectToServer()
      Attempts to establish a connection to the server.
      Returns:
      true if connection established successfully, false otherwise.

    • requestClients

      @Deprecated public void requestClients()
      Deprecated.
      Never needed to specifically request a list of clients from the server anymore.
      Sends a request to the server and obtains the usernames of other possibly connected clients.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String message)
      Sends a message destined for some other client to the server.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be sent. Should start with "nameOfRecipient:", where nameOfRecipient is a variable for the name of the client who the message should be forwarded to by the server.

    • addMessage

      public void addMessage(String sender, String message)
      Adds a new message to a conversation with a specific client.
      Parameters:
      sender - the name of the client who the message was sent by.
      message - the received message.

    • addClients

      public void addClients(String userString)
      Adds to the list of clients which are connected to the same server. Immediately returns without doing anything if the parameter is an empty string.
      Parameters:
      userString - a string containing the username(s) to add. Multiples are separated by commas.

    • removeClient

      public void removeClient(String username)
      Removes a client from the list of connected clients.
      Parameters:
      username - username of the client to remove.

    • setName

      public int setName(String name)
      Used for setting the client's username. The name set by this method is currently used for client identification, meaning that duplicate usernames cannot be used.
      Parameters:
      name - cannot be empty.
      Returns:
      0 if name successfully set, 1 if empty, 2 if any forbidden characters were used.

    • setHostIP

      public boolean setHostIP(String ip)
      Sets the IP of the server to connect to. This practically has no use apart from unit testing.
      Parameters:
      ip - the IP to change the server address to.
      Returns:
      true if IP successfully set, false otherwise.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the username assigned to the client.
      Returns:
      name of the client's username.

    • getSocket

      public SSLSocket getSocket()
      Gets the network socket used for communication with the server.
      Returns:
      the socket connected to the server.

    • getIn

      public DataInputStream getIn()
      Gets the data input stream associated with the socket connected to the server. Used for reading data sent by the server.
      Returns:
      the data input stream associated with the server.

    • getOut

      public DataOutputStream getOut()
      Gets the data output stream associated with the socket connected to the server. Used for sending data to the server.
      Returns:
      the data output stream associated with the server.

    • getListeningThread

      public ListeningThread getListeningThread()
      Gets the listening thread associated with this client. All incoming network traffic is read by this thread after the constructor of this MessengerClient instance is finished.
      Returns:
      the listening thread.

    • getConnectedClients

      public List<String> getConnectedClients()
      Gets an arraylist containing the usernames of all the clients connected to the same server according to the latest info by the server.
      Returns:
      the arraylist of clients.
